item.title: Choosing your first coding language
item.author: Author

item.title: Hello, World!
item.author: Author
item.description: I learned to code on a computer called the BBC Micro, released by the BBC in 1981. I was also released in 1981, and I have a bit of a bond with these 8-bit wonders. Coding is a joyous experience, and anyone can learn to do it. This is a post about retro-coding, and my first written post for this blog. pic.twitter.com/y5zy1P2TAE — BBC Micro ðŸŽ„ Bot (@bbcmicrobot) March 1, 2020 Hello, World!
